text: 6日以内に1秒でも早く
translation: As soon as possible, within 6 days
grammar: でも after a question word (1秒でも) means 'even one/any', emphasizing the minimal amount

text: しかしシンジのやつどないしたんやろ / 学校休んでもう3日か
translation: But I wonder what happened to Shinji / Already 3 days absent from school, huh
grammar: Kansai dialect: どない = どう (how/what), やろ = だろう (I wonder). もう adds emphasis 'already'

text: あれ、委員長やんか / サ / ンバカトリオの二人 / なんで委員長がここにおるんや / ソウリュウさんのお見舞い / あなたたちこそどうしてここに / ヒカリ君のお見舞い / なんでここ / で泊まるんだ
translation: Oh, it's the class representative / Sa- / You two from the Stooges trio / Why is the class rep here / Visiting Soryu / Why are you here / Visiting Hikari / Why are you / staying here
grammar: やんか (Kansai) = じゃないか. こそ adds contrastive emphasis 'you of all people'. おる (Kansai) = いる

text: はーい
translation: Yes!
grammar: Extended はーい shows casual/cheerful response

text: 裏切りもん / またしても今どきペアルック / いやーんな感じ。 / こ、 / これは日本人は形から入る / ものだって。 / 無理やりミサトさんは。
translation: Traitor / And now, matching outfits of all things / Ugh, what a feeling. / Th- / This is because Japanese people start from appearances. / Misato-san forced us.
grammar: もん (Kansai) = もの (person). またしても emphasizes repetition/exasperation. って quotative particle for hearsay

text: うけつよ!二人とも! / ご、誤解だよ! / 誤解は6回もないわ! / いらっしゃい。 / え?
translation: That's hilarious! Both of you! / It's, it's a misunderstanding! / Misunderstandings don't happen 6 times! / Welcome. / Huh?

vocabulary.meaning: to be funny, to get a laugh

grammar: うける (slang) means something is funny/amusing. 6回も emphasizes 'as many as 6 times', suggesting impossibility

text: これは、どういうことか説明してください。
translation: Please explain what this is all about.

vocabulary.meaning: what kind of, what sort of

grammar: どういうことか creates an embedded question 'what kind of thing this is'

text: そーとん、はよ言うてくれたらよかったのに。 / で、ユニゾーはうまくいってるんですか?
translation: Soryu, you should have told us earlier. / So, is the unison training going well?
grammar: たらよかったのに expresses regret 'it would have been good if...'. Kansai: はよ=早く, 言うて=言って

text: それは見ての通りなのよ。
translation: It's just as you can see.

vocabulary.meaning: as you can see, just as it appears

grammar: 見ての通り is a set phrase meaning 'as you can see'. の nominalizes, よ adds assertion

text: あったりまえじゃない / このシンジに合わせてレベル下げるなんて / うまくいくわけないわ / 土台無理な話なのよ / じゃあやめとく
translation: Of course not / Having to lower my level to match this Shinji / There's no way it'll go well / It's impossible from the start / Then I'll quit

vocabulary.meaning: to quit, to stop (colloquial for やめておく)

grammar: わけない expresses impossibility 'there's no way/reason that...'. なんて belittles 'something like...'

text: 他に人いないんでしょ
translation: There's no one else, right?
grammar: んでしょ contracts のでしょう, seeking confirmation with slight challenge/sarcasm

text: レイ / はい / やってみて / はい
translation: Rei / Yes / Try it / Yes
grammar: てみて is て-form of てみる (try doing), used as command. Brief はい shows compliance

text: これは作戦変更してレイと組んだ方がいいかもね
translation: Maybe it would be better to change the strategy and pair up with Rei

vocabulary.meaning: to team up, to pair up

grammar: した方がいい expresses recommendation/better option. かもね softens with uncertainty and ね seeks agreement

text: もう嫌!やってらんないわ!
translation: I've had enough! I can't deal with this anymore!

vocabulary.meaning: can't deal with it (colloquial for やっていられない)

grammar: やってらんない is casual contraction of やっていられない expressing inability to continue tolerating something

text: アスカス! / 鬼 / の目にも涙や / イカーリーくーん
translation: Asuka! / Even demons / shed tears / Ikari-kun!
grammar: 鬼の目にも涙 is a proverb meaning 'even demons cry' (even the harshest person shows emotion). や (Kansai) = だ

text: 追いか / けて / 女の子泣かせたのよ / 責任取りなさいよ
translation: Go after / her / You made a girl cry / Take responsibility
grammar: 泣かせた is causative past 'made (someone) cry'. なさい is imperative command form. のよ adds feminine assertion

text: 何も言わないで
translation: Don't say anything
grammar: ないで is negative te-form making a request/command 'don't do'. 何も with negative means 'nothing at all'

text: 分かってるわ / 私はエヴァに乗るしかないのよ
translation: I know / I have no choice but to pilot Eva

vocabulary.meaning: have no choice but, only option

grammar: しかない expresses 'no choice but to...'. のよ is feminine assertive ending particle

text: やるわ私
translation: I'll do it
grammar: やるわ with わ shows feminine determination. 私 at end emphasizes the subject 'I (will do it)'

text: こうなったら何としてもレイやミサトを見返してやるのよ / そんな見返したなんて
translation: Now that it's come to this, I'll show Rei and Misato no matter what / Something like getting revenge...

vocabulary.meaning: now that it's come to this, in this situation
no matter what, by all means
to show someone up, to prove someone wrong

grammar: やる after verb adds nuance of doing something to/for someone (sometimes negatively). なんて belittles the concept

text: 何甘いこと言ってんのよ男のくせに / 傷つけられた
translation: What are you saying such weak things for, even though you're a guy / When you've been hurt
grammar: 言ってんのよ contracts 言っているのよ. くせに criticizes despite condition. られた is passive 'was hurt'

text: プライドは10倍にして返してやるのよ
translation: You pay back wounded pride tenfold
grammar: にして marks the manner/state 'as 10 times'. やる adds nuance of doing to someone. のよ is assertive

text: ミサトは? / 仕事 / 今夜は徹夜だって / さっき電話が
translation: Where's Misato? / Work / She said she's pulling an all-nighter tonight / She called just now
grammar: だって is casual quotation marker 'she said that...'. Truncated sentences are common in casual conversation

text: じゃあ今夜は二人っきりってわけね / ん?
translation: So that means it's just the two of us tonight / Hm?

vocabulary.meaning: just the two of us, alone together

grammar: っきり suffix means 'just/only'. ってわけ contracts というわけ 'it means that...'. ね seeks confirmation

text: これは決して崩れることのないジェリコの壁! / はぁ… / この壁をちょっとでも超えたら死刑よ! / 子供は夜更かししないで寝なさい!
translation: This is the impregnable Wall of Jericho! / *sigh*... / If you cross this wall even a little bit, it's the death penalty! / Children shouldn't stay up late, go to sleep!
grammar: ことのない creates a noun phrase 'that won't collapse'. たら conditional 'if you do...'. なさい is imperative command form
